bug.author: monhoney
bug.summary: An error occurs when finetune wav2vec 2.0 with hydra-train
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
I am trying to finetuning using the wav2vec 2.0 base pretrained model. I downloaded the wav2vec_small_100h.pt model and changed the name to wav2vec_small.pt. I ran finetune according to the manual, but the following error occurs: <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior (always include the command you ran):
Run cmd
<denchmark-code>fairseq-hydra-train \ distributed_training.distributed_port=22000 \ task.data=/work/volumes/manifest \ model.w2v_path=/work/volumes/pretrained_model/wav2vec_small.pt \ --config-dir /work/fairseq/examples/wav2vec/config/finetuning \ --config-name base_100h </denchmark-code>
See error
<denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "/opt/conda/bin/fairseq-hydra-train", line 33, in <module> sys.exit(load_entry_point('fairseq', 'console_scripts', 'fairseq-hydra-train')()) File "/work/fairseq/fairseq_cli/hydra_train.py", line 66, in cli_main hydra_main() File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/hydra/main.py", line 37, in decorated_main strict=strict, File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/hydra/_internal/utils.py", line 347, in _run_hydra lambda: hydra.run( File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/hydra/_internal/utils.py", line 201, in run_and_report raise ex File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/hydra/_internal/utils.py", line 198, in run_and_report return func() File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/hydra/_internal/utils.py", line 350, in <lambda> overrides=args.overrides, File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/hydra/_internal/hydra.py", line 112, in run configure_logging=with_log_configuration, File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/hydra/core/utils.py", line 125, in run_job ret.return_value = task_function(task_cfg) File "/work/fairseq/fairseq_cli/hydra_train.py", line 38, in hydra_main distributed_utils.call_main(cfg, pre_main) File "/work/fairseq/fairseq/distributed_utils.py", line 334, in call_main main(cfg, **kwargs) File "/work/fairseq/fairseq_cli/train.py", line 74, in main model = task.build_model(cfg.model) File "/work/fairseq/fairseq/tasks/audio_pretraining.py", line 201, in build_model model = super().build_model(model_cfg) File "/work/fairseq/fairseq/tasks/fairseq_task.py", line 282, in build_model model = models.build_model(cfg, self) File "/work/fairseq/fairseq/models/__init__.py", line 86, in build_model return model.build_model(cfg, task) File "/work/fairseq/fairseq/models/wav2vec/wav2vec2_asr.py", line 147, in build_model w2v_encoder = Wav2VecEncoder(cfg, task.target_dictionary) File "/work/fairseq/fairseq/models/wav2vec/wav2vec2_asr.py", line 304, in __init__ model.remove_pretraining_modules() File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 779, in __getattr__ type(self).__name__, name)) torch.nn.modules.module.ModuleAttributeError: 'Wav2VecCtc' object has no attribute 'remove_pretraining_modules' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h4>Code sample</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
fairseq Version (e.g., 1.0 or master): master PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0) OS (e.g., Linux): Linux How you installed fairseq (pip, source): pip install --editable ./ Build command you used (if compiling from source): Python version: CUDA/cuDNN version: GPU models and configuration: Any other relevant information:
<denchmark-h:h3>Additional context</denchmark-h>

comments.comment: I read this link(<denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/issues/2539#issuecomment-683292257>#2539 (comment)</denchmark-link> ) and it worked. Thank you.
hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/monhoney>@monhoney</denchmark-link> ,i'm facing the same problem as above, how do you solve it?

hi @monhoney,i'm facing the same problem as above, how do you solve it?
To do fine tune, you need to download and use the no-finetune model in model.w2v_path.
